type.name: org.gradle.api.logging.LoggingManager
type.description: A LoggingManager provides access to and control over the Gradle logging system. Using this interface, you can control the current logging level and standard output and error capture.

method.name: captureStandardError
method.description:
Requests that output written to System.err be routed to Gradle's logging system. The default is that System.err is routed to LogLevel#ERROR.
param:level The log level to route System.err to.

returns:this

method.name: captureStandardOutput
method.description:
Requests that output written to System.out be routed to Gradle's logging system. The default is that System.out is routed to LogLevel#QUIET
param:level The log level to route System.out to.

returns:this

method.name: getLevel
method.description:
Returns the current logging level.

returns:The current logging level.

method.name: getStandardErrorCaptureLevel
method.description:
Returns the log level that output written to System.err will be mapped to.

returns:The log level. Returns null when standard error capture is disabled.

method.name: getStandardOutputCaptureLevel
method.description:
Returns the log level that output written to System.out will be mapped to.

returns:The log level. Returns null when standard output capture is disabled.

property.name: level
property.description:
Returns the current logging level.

returns:The current logging level.

property.name: standardErrorCaptureLevel
property.description:
Returns the log level that output written to System.err will be mapped to.

returns:The log level. Returns null when standard error capture is disabled.

property.name: standardOutputCaptureLevel
property.description:
Returns the log level that output written to System.out will be mapped to.

returns:The log level. Returns null when standard output capture is disabled.
